alert.note: Alert for Tooele (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 3:24PM MDT until August 02 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Jacob City burn scar in... Eastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 324 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Jacob City Burn Scar. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through several watershed areas within the burned area, and then into Soldier Creek and points downstream to SR 36. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stockton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Jacob City Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
